title: Ministry hails pact with Spanish club
summary:
The Ministry of Tourism has said its six months agreement with Spanish second-tier football league outfit Club Deportivo Leganés, as part of a strategy to expand Malawi’s brand awareness, was a success.

The agreement, which was signed in January 2023, meant the team wore kits bearing the “Malawi, T...

The Ministry of Tourism has said its six months agreement with Spanish second-tier football league outfit Club Deportivo Leganés, as part of a strategy to expand Malawi’s brand awareness, was a success.

The agreement, which was signed in January 2023, meant the team wore kits bearing the “Malawi, The Warm Heart of Africa” logo

title: Musicians cry foul over studio session fee hike
summary:
By Jimmy Chazama:

Some musicians have expressed concern over the adjustment of studio sessions by Producers and Audio Engineering Association of Malawi (Paem) members.

Paem members have pegged the price at K1 million per song.

The musicians say the amount is on the higher side, such that some gif...

By Jimmy Chazama:

Some musicians have expressed concern over the adjustment of studio sessions by Producers and Audio Engineering Association of Malawi (Paem) members.

Paem members have pegged the price at K1 million per song.

title: Miss Malawi opens for 2026 registration
summary:
By Jimmy Chazama:

The Miss Malawi pageant has opened the 2026 registration period.

Organisers have since called upon young women across the country to register and participate in the beauty pageant.

The application period runs from February 1 to March 31, 2026.

According to organisers, applicant...
text_preview:
By Jimmy Chazama:

The Miss Malawi pageant has opened the 2026 registration period.

Organisers have since called upon young women across the country to register and participate in the beauty pageant.

The application period runs from February 1 to March 31, 2026.

According to organisers, applicants need to pay a registration fee of K30,000, among other things.

title: Malawi submits Khulubvi nomination to Unesco
summary:

title: Malawi team leaves for festival in India
summary:

title: Suffer Now, Eat Later? Government Defends Painful Economic Plan
summary: Minister of Finance Joseph Mwanamvekha has told Malawians that they must be ready to suffer now so that the economy can improve in the future. Speaking in Mzuzu during pre-budget talks, Mwanamvekha said the government will continue with tough economic measures under the National Economic Recovery Plan (NERP), even though life is already very hard for most people.

title: Tobacco Demand Drops, Raising Concerns for Farmers and the Economy
summary:
Malawi’s tobacco industry is facing a tough season. Preliminary reports show that buyers want to purchase only 170 million kilograms of tobacco in the 2025/26 season. This is 25 percent less than last year, when buyers bought 213 million kilograms.

The number of companies buying tobacco is also fal...
text_preview:
Malawi’s tobacco industry is facing a tough season. Preliminary reports show that buyers want to purchase only 170 million kilograms of tobacco in the 2025/26 season. This is 25 percent less than last year, when buyers bought 213 million kilograms.

The number of companies buying tobacco is also falling—from 11 last year to 8 this year. Experts warn that fewer buyers could push prices down, which ...

title: APM Delivers: Over 100,000 Tonnes of Maize from Zambia Begin Arriving in Malawi
summary:
President Peter Mutharika is keeping his promise to fight hunger in Malawi as the first batch of 103,000 metric tonnes of maize—part of the 200,000MT procured from Zambia—begins entering the country through the Mchinji-Mwami border.

Both local and international transporters are moving the maize fro...
text_preview:
President Peter Mutharika is keeping his promise to fight hunger in Malawi as the first batch of 103,000 metric tonnes of maize—part of the 200,000MT procured from Zambia—begins entering the country through the Mchinji-Mwami border.

Both local and international transporters are moving the maize from Zambia’s Food Reserve Agency silos in Chipata to Malawi’s National Food Reserve Agency in Lilongwe...
